issue.title: [CF 1155] Help - Accessing unit name inside lua
issue.body:
TellMeWhen v7.3.5

Hello,

I am beginner (extreme beginner in fact ) in LUA but maybe you can help me with a simple example.

I have an icon (group) icon which shows group 1-40, the first icon presents one of the raid members and it's changing based on unit conditions.

What i need is to access inside the notification/on left click LuA segment *** the name of the unit (player) which the icon is showing - I will change it to OnUnitChange after i finish working.

a sample "print(SomethingCleverToShowPlayerName)" will be great.

Thanks.

***
I need to acces the unit name here:
-- <Untitled Lua Code>

local icon = ...

--Your code goes here:
asdfghjkl;


> Posted by CurseForge user AltAlex | Imported from CurseForge issue #1155 | Raw

comments.body:
I have had that problem a bit ago and I got an answer from a previous ticket you want to access this attribute in the object icon : icon.attributes.unit

This should return the name of the unit the icon is currently targeting. You can see my original Ticket here : http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/tickets/1058-notification-target-marking/

Edited Sep 3, 2015

> Posted by CurseForge user InfernalAura

yep, thanks, found your issue later on.

icon.attributes.unit is the answer that worked for me, is not the name is the "party#n" or "raid#n" but it's perfect for what i need.


> Posted by CurseForge user AltAlex
